benefits.title: The dietary flavonoid quercetin increases VO(2max) and endurance capacity.
benefits.summary: Quercetin supplementation can increase endurance without exercise training in untrained participants, potentially enhancing athletic and military performance.
benefits.journal: International journal of sport nutrition and exercise metabolism

benefits.title: Health Benefits of Quercetin in Age-Related Diseases
benefits.summary: Quercetin has antioxidant properties, anti-inflammatory, anti-proliferative, anti-carcinogenic, anti-diabetic, and anti-viral properties, and plays a crucial role in the prevention of age-related disorders.

benefits.title: Health effects of quercetin: from antioxidant to nutraceutical.
benefits.summary: Quercetin is a prominent dietary antioxidant that protects against diseases like osteoporosis, cancer, pulmonary and cardiovascular diseases, and aging.

benefits.title: Quercetin, Inflammation and Immunity
benefits.summary: Quercetin has anti-carcinogenic, anti-inflammatory, and antiviral activities, as well as attenuating lipid peroxidation, platelet aggregation, and capillary permeability.

benefits.title: In vivo quercitrin anti‐inflammatory effect involves release of quercetin, which inhibits inflammation through down‐regulation of the NF‐κB pathway
benefits.summary: Quercitrin releases quercetin, which inhibits inflammation through down-regulation of the NFÎ± B pathway.

benefits.title: Antioxidant and anti-inflammatory activities of quercetin and its derivatives
benefits.summary: Quercetin derivatives may act as potent antioxidant and anti-inflammatory agents, contributing to overall biological activity of a quercetin-rich diet.

benefits.title: The biological activities, chemical stability, metabolism and delivery systems of quercetin: A review
benefits.summary: Quercetin has health benefits such as antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, antiviral, anticancer, and eases cardiovascular diseases like heart disease, hypertension, and high blood cholesterol.
benefits.journal: Trends in Food Science and Technology

benefits.title: Therapeutic Potential of Quercetin: New Insights and Perspectives for Human Health
benefits.summary: Quercetin has antidiabetic, anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, antimicrobial, anti-Alzheimer's, antiarthritic, cardiovascular, and wound-healing effects, and has anticancer activity against different cancer cell lines.

benefits.title: Molecular Targets Underlying the Anticancer Effects of Quercetin: An Update
benefits.summary: Quercetin protects against diseases like osteoporosis, certain malignant tumors, and pulmonary and cardiovascular disorders by scavenging highly reactive species.

benefits.title: Quercetin and the mitochondria: A mechanistic view.
benefits.summary: Quercetin can modulate pathways associated with mitochondrial biogenesis, membrane potential, oxidative respiration, ATP anabolism, and mitochondria-induced apoptosis, offering protection against mitochondrial damage.

side effects.title: Quercetin accumulation by chronic administration causes the caspase‐3 activation in liver and brain of mice
side effects.summary: Chronic administration of quercetin at high doses may induce apoptosis in the liver and brain of mice, with the brain being more susceptible to apoptosis than the liver.

side effects.title: The supplement-drug interaction of quercetin with tamsulosin on vasorelaxation.
side effects.summary: Quercetin induces vasorelaxation and decreases phenylephrine sensitivity, but the combination of tamsulosin and quercetin can decrease this sensitivity even more.

side effects.title: Quercetin inhibits prostate cancer by attenuating cell survival and inhibiting anti-apoptotic pathways
side effects.summary: Quercetin inhibits prostate cancer cell survival and leads to apoptotic and necrotic cell death without affecting normal prostate epithelial cells.

side effects.title: Quercetin inhibits lymphocyte activation and proliferation without inducing apoptosis in peripheral mononuclear cells.
side effects.summary: Quercetin inhibits normal immune functions like T cell proliferation and activation, but does not induce apoptosis in normal cells.

side effects.title: Investigation of the binding mechanism and inhibition of bovine liver catalase by quercetin: Multi-spectroscopic and computational study
side effects.summary: Quercetin can inhibit bovine liver catalase activity through a non-competitive manner.

side effects.title: Low side-effect and heat-shock protein-inhibited chemo-phototherapy nanoplatform via co-assembling strategy of biotin-tailored IR780 and quercetin
side effects.summary: Quercetin is a naturally low-side effect anticancer drug and heat shock protein inhibitor for tailoring phototherapy.

side effects.title: The pro‐apoptotic effect of quercetin in cancer cell lines requires ERβ‐dependent signals
side effects.summary: Quercetin mimics the effects of estrogen in cancer cell lines by activating p38, a pro-apoptotic signaling pathway.

side effects.title: Drug combinations with quercetin: doxorubicin plus quercetin in human breast cancer cells
side effects.summary: Quercetin combined with doxorubicin increased doxorubicin effects in highly invasive breast cancer cells and reduced side effects in non-tumoral cells.

side effects.title: Antidepressant Potential of Quercetin and its Glycoside Derivatives: A Comprehensive Review and Update
side effects.summary: Quercetin has various pharmacological effects such as anti-depressant, anti-cancer, antibacterial, antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and neuroprotective.

side effects.title: Effects of quercetin on single Ca(2+) release channel behavior of skeletal muscle.
side effects.summary: Quercetin activates Ca(2+) release channels marginally at low concentrations, but increases sensitivity to the drug at elevated concentrations.

dosage.title: Daily quercetin supplementation dose-dependently increases plasma quercetin concentrations in healthy humans.
dosage.summary: Quercetin supplementation at 50, 100, and 150 mg/d dose-dependently increased plasma quercetin concentrations in healthy humans.

dosage.title: Effects of Quercetin on Blood Pressure: A Systematic Review and Meta‐Analysis of Randomized Controlled Trials
dosage.summary: Quercetin supplementation has a significant effect on reducing blood pressure, possibly limited to or greater with dosages of >500 mg/day.
dosage.journal: Journal of the American Heart Association: Cardiovascular and Cerebrovascular Disease

dosage.title: Serum Metabolomics Analysis of Quercetin against Acrylamide-Induced Toxicity in Rats.
dosage.summary: Quercetin (50 mg/kg bw) exerts partial protective effects on acrylamide-induced toxicity by reducing oxidative stress, protecting the mitochondria, and regulating lipid metabolism.
dosage.journal: Journal of agricultural and food chemistry

dosage.title: Metabolomics analysis of the effects of quercetin on renal toxicity induced by cadmium exposure in rats
dosage.summary: Quercetin dosages in this study were 10 and 50 mg/kgbw.

dosage.title: Effects of supplementation with quercetin on plasma C-reactive protein concentrations: a systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials
dosage.summary: Quercetin supplementation significantly reduces circulating C-reactive protein levels, especially at doses above 500 mg/day and in patients with CRP 3 mg/l.

dosage.title: Quercetin supplementation and its effect on human monocyte gene expression profiles in vivo
dosage.summary: Quercetin supplementation at 150 mg daily led to minimal changes in gene expression in human monocytes.

dosage.title: Effects of quercetin on the bioavailability of doxorubicin in rats: Role of CYP3A4 and P-gp inhibition by quercetin
dosage.summary: Oral quercetin dosages range from 0.6 to 15 mg/kg, with a maximum effect at 15 mg/kg.

dosage.title: Quercetin promotes functional recovery following acute spinal cord injury.
dosage.summary: Dose ranges from 5 to 100 micromoles quercetin/kg body weight, with half or more of the animals walking, although with deficit, after acute traumatic spinal cord injury.

dosage.title: Effects of quercetin supplementation on glycemic control among patients with metabolic syndrome and related disorders: A systematic review and meta‐analysis of randomized controlled trials
dosage.summary: Quercetin supplementation in dosages of 500 mg/day significantly reduced fasting plasma glucose levels in studies with a duration of 8 weeks.

dosage.title: Metabonomics analysis of quercetin against the nephrotoxicity of acrylamide in rats.
dosage.summary: Quercetin dosages tested in this study were 10 and 50 mg per kg bw per day.
